refnamediv.refpurpose: Write image to file in any format

varlistentry.listitem: A string, the image filename to be created. The extension determines the type of the image.
For truecolor images, this is a MxNx3 hypermatrix in 0-1 range; For binary images or intensity grayscale images, it is a MxNx1 matrix in 0-1 range.
MxN matrix containing the indexes to the image colormap (for indexed images). Indices start at 1.

listitem.para: Mx3 matrix containing the image colormap (for indexed images). Entries range from 0 to 1.
This is a sequence of statements key1=value1, key2=value2,... where key1, key2,... can be one of the following:
the quality level for some formats of images that accept this parameter, like JPEG. Ranges from 1 to 100 (default 75).

variablelist.para: In the future, other options may be added, such as dithering and compression type.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: imwrite creates BMP, GIF, JPEG, PNG, PCX, TIFF, XPM, and many more types of image files from Scilab matrices. The format of the file is inferred from the extension in the filename parameter.

varlistentry.listitem: creates an image filename in disk, from Img matrix. For truecolor images, Img is a MxNx3 hypermatrix, so for example Img(:,:,1) stands for the red channel. For binary images or intensity grayscale images, Img is a MxNx1 matrix.
does the same job from Index (MxN) and Map (Mx3) matrices. Grayscale and Paletted images are written in this way.
